reviewText:
Product received for free

This game feels more like it belongs to a Mobile App than something that should be on Steam.

I've played and seen similar games within the Mobile App stores; this game in particular seems to have a combination of systems utilized: The fusion/max-level bonus evolution system found in multiple card game RPGs, and the battle system is reminiciant of the advancing army" style of play. This style of gameplay isn't as common as other types of games within the Mobile market
date: but it is present.\n\nThat's about as much good I can say
recommended: however. There's definitely many more bads to goods to this Steam App:\n\nWhen I played the game
hoursPlayed: the game felt a bit laggy while controlling my characters or navigating the menu. I don't know if it's my OS that caused this
voteText: but it very quickly got irritating.\n\nThe UI doesn't feel modified for a PC. Often

commentsCount: which is something one SHOULD fix when porting a game from the Mobile market.\n\nFinally
column16: when I tried closing the window with Alt+F4 or the corner button
column17: it instead kept bringing me to the Gem Purchase menu. I get that the game is free-to-play

column19: especially when all I wanted to do was close the game. This part here was the nail in the coffin towards my feelings about this game; it felt less like a legitimate attempt at a good game and more like an attempt to desperately harvest money from players."

reviewText:
Forge of Gods

+FUN +FREE +ADDICTIVE +ACHIEVEMENTS +CARDS

This game has the usual band of haters of freeium gaming bringing down the reviews, however I think the game is fine.

Have sunk 50 hours into it (so far) and have bought 2 x DLC on steam as I would have paid $10 for it anyway, and I think the DEVs deserve some money for their efforts and my enjoyment.

There is no paywall NOR is there a need to buy gems to get ahead.

The game itself is a progressive adventure/RPG where you build an army by evolving monsters and pitting them against others in PVP/Guilds or the game PVE.

Its free, what have you got to lose?

reviewText:
You know, I read the reviews and I expected to hate this game almost immediately.
I didn't hate it as it turns out but I didn't fall in love with it either.

Its lazy. You have played this game before even if you haven't played it under this specific name. You know the type, collect low ranked monsters and merge them together to create higher ranked monsters then merge even more of those but watch that you don't run out of 'stamina', which is named food in this game, for some reason.

A google search showed their used to be cheat engine codes to bypass that draconian measure but all I could find were viruses which is kind of a shame really, if they got rid of the stamina system you would still have a boring time, but it would be less boring as you grind stage one ad infinity. Well, you would if you could since every time you do the same stage, the rewards diminish which strikes me as odd. The rewards are not stellar anyway and its in your best interests to keep moving forwards but then this isn't a game in the traditional sense anyway.

The cash shop bombards you frequently as you try to play and try as I might to ignore it, it just adds more clicks to get things done since you need to shove the cash shop out of your face every waking moment. So since its always around why don't we take a look at whats for sale shall we?

You can buy stamina, because of course you can. You can also buy lottery tickets for a chance to get cool monsters. You can buy temporary boost items for PvE/PvP

That's it. Yup, the shop that they shove so hard in your face, doesn't even contain all that much anyway and you know something else? It isn't because they wanted the game to be 'fair' or anything like that, its because the game i that shallow that they don't have anything much to sell you. So even if you wanted to spend money on the game their isn't much point.

Finally PvP...Doesn't exist. Its the old, you play against a AI controlled 'player team' and if you caught it earlier, you can use items during it but they can't, since they are AI controlled. Player vs AI is NOT Player vs Player but steam (and other such app stores) allow these games to market themselves as such but if you were expecting to lord over peasents then I am afraid this game isn't for you.

Its not for anyone really unless you enjoy CCG, which I do. Sure it doesn't say its a CCG but lets be honest, collecting monsters, merging them, how mny F2P games use this forumla? Most of them are card games and regardless of how this one presents itself its basically a card game despite what it says on the store page.

As far as a CCG goes, they are all the same for their is only 1 CCG in the known universe with every other type being  derivative off it. If you enjoy Magic the gather and/or YuGiOh and/or Pokemon CCG; you get the idea.

Join Grumpy reviews for all your gaming needs
http://steamcommunity.com/groups/grumpyreviews

reviewText:
You may use my promo code: WNFYEO

- You need starter pack to levelup faster
(It helps you as much as 15 days of work, you may consider starting the game as early as possible)
- Packs are worth a load of money
(I buried more money than Skyrim: Legendary Edition to the cheapest pack which was also a crazy 90%~ish time limited starter offer)
- Although 2 min timer is good, energy is still limited
(Game enforces player to log on per 3h which sucks. The days of screen slavery games are over.
Steam should put its own limitations for these cancer genre games or they dont deserve this quality gamerbase.
For Steam, even daily logins are too restrictive. Max energy that would fill in 12h would be balanced. Or we need a hack that would always work.)
- Inventory space is limited
(Green crystals you earn from starter quests are not enough, buying them costs one more game price)
- Mega evolve may need many leveled units depending on the recipe
(Keeping track of unit exp appearing on the evolve recipe for all possible evolves needed)

+ Auto-move is fluent which relaxes gameplay
+ Unit upgrades are fun
+ Game seems alive atm

reviewText:
I love this game. I've played a lot of MMOs in my time and two of the most fun aspects for me in MMOs were crafting and PVP. This game sort of combines those two elements. You gather monster to essentially crafter bigger and stronger monster and you put your creations up against other players creations and see who wins. I've put a total of $25 dollars into the game and I have access to everything and there is plenty to do in game for a couple hours a day if you dont want to buy more energy.

It is grindy, but I love when I grind a zone looking for that rare elite monster and it finally drops. There is no better feeling. There is no instant gratification in this game, and to me that is part of what makes it fun.

The developers are always around in the discussion area and on other forums for the game.

There was a recent PVP tournament that had a few bugs and players were awarded $30 worth of cash shop gems. I love that type of customer care. They know they messed up and they tried to fix the problems quickly and awarded the players who had to deal with the bugs.

If you like crafting , pvp, and dont mind a little grind. Play this game!

reviewText:
If you want to add me, this is my ID: OXSVTR
Forge of Gods
Review: 5 of June, 2016

First Impression:
Rate: 6/10

Overall the game is pretty solid, it as a similar system like other browser, android, Ios games with that it uses a Stamina system for missions and a separate stamina for PVP. You have in-game currency and premium currency that allows you to buy a chest (like CS: GO) that have a chance to drop greater monsters.

This game is based on team composition that you need to build a team with different type of roles and monsters, each one with their strength's and weakness's. Early game you receive few rare monsters to help you with your progress, but later on it's basically grinding for them or lucky RNG with the chests.

This also includes a VIP System that gives you an advantage, not noticeable at the begging, but it will be a huge gap between a VIP and a Non-VIP player the longer you play the game. Nothing is really Pay 2 Win, except the part that you can buy the chest but still, that's a random chance to get good stuff. What you can do with the premium currency is to advance your progress faster.

Is you are in to these type of games, go ahead and try it, probabilly you will enjoy like my self.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Update again (and final verdict):
Let us face it. This game is not a time waister. It is a waist of time.
Devs do care care about cheaters, but not here (blame the facebook and mobile version).
Since the game is well polished from the start (like every f2p game), things get horrible as you move on.
You will meet paywall after paywall after paywall.
Wait 3 hours here and after that you wait another 7h there.
And while you are waiting you could spent some of your money to at least get a shot a the top notch.
The game has two energy bars... Food (or so) for PvE, which feels fine with a recharge amount of 3 mins.
And one for PvP. It refills after 30 minutes. 30!
And you only got five of them.
To use them in your guild wars, your daily PVP rank AND your tournament progress.

Overall the game is not bad. Not at all.
But is never meant to be on Steam.
It is a Facebook game, play it there.

Forge of Gods is another mobile game, which made it to Steam.
Collector game, with a nice little strategic gameplay, but don't expect to much from RPG" in the title.
You collect creatures and evolve them. Not a real RPG
date:
like equiping items and puting points into stuff like strenght or so.

But what so ever great time waster.
And NO... you don't need money to have success in the game. No pay walls
recommended: no unbeatable-because-money stuff.\nBut... it has the energy system
hoursPlayed: and of course you can fill up the bars (yeah
voteText:
game has two bars - one for PVE and one for PVP) by spending money.

Pros:

- accessive gameplay

- graphics are okay. It is a mobile strategy port

reviewText:
Product received for free

For a free game I can't be to harsh on it but jeez.... ok let's just get this over with.
Before I talk about this games pros and cons I'm just going to say that if they improve the gameplay I may, MAY, play it again :3

Pros-
> It's free and doesn't take long to get the hang of,
> A quest system! I love quests!
> I like it that you can check what the enemies stats are while in a battle
> There are multiple characters to pick at the beginning, giving variety to the play styles

Cons-
>  The intro video doesn't tell you ANYTHING interesting about the game.
> I thought the quests would be decent, but they're REALLY not.
> The music might as well be wake me up inside ear ♥♥♥♥
> The music is muffled, making it very unconfortable to play levels slowly
> The tutoriel kinda ends quickly and leaves you in the dark for a while, giving you blinds tips every few minutes,
> Ok ok ok, wtf is up with spiders, like seriously its difficult to get through the third/fourth level with them against you
> Your character/any of your people can be countered EASILY
> 'Collected' souls seem to be able to flee, how are they collected if they're going to flee?

But the thing that bugged me the most, was not the music, not the ads begging for you to spend some of your money (don't), but the thing that made me stop playing the game was the tutoriel.
The tutoriel might aswell just give you the first level, show you where you can see our army  outside of battle and then leave. It COMPLETELY defeats the objective of a tutoriel. Also, by the time you get to the end of the fourth level, all of your army members get either one shot by the mobs at the first wave, or deal NO damage what so ever, let alone the giant just ♥♥♥♥♥♥ you like there's no tomorrow.

Now, like I said it's a free game, so you cant say it's a waste of money, however it was a waste of my time, just clicking the 'go' button about 1000 times, please if you are considering to atleast try this game out you need to be calm at the beginning otherwise you won't get anyway (without buying anything with  real money)

~I hope this review helped you (if you actually read it)

reviewText: It's a free to play game and it's fair to assume it has microtransactions. The best part is that you can buy any almost any microtransaction or pack with in-game currency and it's fair priced. It's a game built on loot addiction, so much so that early in the game it offers the option to auto-play every fight stage. As expected, you start kicking butt, taking lots of units for your army, upgrading, smooth stuff, and then it gets muddy, slow, grindy, very grindy. And that's okay. You can buy stuff with real money, or devise a strategy to find the best early stage with high amount of loot and keep grinding. It can be fun, if you like browser games like Candy Crush Saga mixed with kinda Heroes of Might & Magic type of gameplay, but neither production value. It's okay looking, the drawings are nice, don't expect animations.\nHere's where I got with the game: you kinda have to upgrade your army, even after you max level every unit, that's where the game drags. To get more units, you need to capture them, and some of the units flee, unless you pay with gems (in-game currency). Everything has to be paid with gems to progress, otherwise just wait and wait you will. So in trying to evolve one of my units, I had to get eggs. Just damn dragon eggs or something like that. But here's the fun part: the eggs fled. How the hell does an egg flee? It's stupid, like the way this game managed to get on Steam's store!

reviewText:
It's weird that most reviews focus on free-to-play aspect of the game. As if all ftp games are bad by default. It's not like this. I've played a lot of ftp games without paying anything and enjoyed a lot of them.

This game is one of those that I enjoyed. I played it on Kongregate and got to level 40 before I got bored with it.

About the game: you make a team of different units with a lot of passive skills and clear dungeons in turn-based combat where you press forward button and see your team moving one step forward (unless they are blocked) and turn actions resolve - archers shoot, healers heal, some abilities trigger, some units die, etc. You can change formation of your units in a team, you can use some one-time boosts, you can order everyone to focus on one enemy. When enemy units die they sometimes drop souls that you can capture and have them join your team. Outside the battle you can evolve units by combining several lower tier ones into higher tier ones. Depending on certain circumstances (time, level, elite status) units gain a certain bonus to their stats after evolving. Later in the game you can also upgrade your castle that gives minor boosts to units/skills/evolution and provides some extra daily income.

There are several types of stages that are available in the game: campaign stages (each node has 3 difficulties and has a certain setup of enemies so you can farm them for units that you need), daily challenges (each map requires a certain team composition and provides special rewards), weekly portals (they have certain enemies required for higher tier evolutions and access to them changes depending on the day of the week), pvp (these are just battles against other player's teams).

Special currency: main currency that you buy for real money can be easily acquired while playing the game. You gain small amounts for finishing each campaign mission for the first time, you gain small amount from the mine in your castle, you gain some for daily logins and most important source - you gain some for finishing several daily missions. You will need that currency mostly to unlock extra slots for your army, but even default amount of slots (50) is enough to keep a good amount of captured units if you don't suffer from I must keep them all!".

Pros:
1. Easy to learn (but rather intricate due to a lot of passive skills) turn-based battle system
2. Interesting evolution system
3. Easy access to special currency
4. Interesting process of farming/grinding for units to evolve if you enjoy such things
5. You can continue to max unit stats after evolving the unit by doing daily challenges for special units that boost them slightly

Cons:
1. Energy (Food) system that I personally hate in such games (though it's is not very restricting in this game)
2. PVP had a lot of enemy teams that were really strong and you could not understand it before choosing to attack them (this may have changed after I stopped playing the game)
3. Farming/grinding for units can become rather boring after a while because chances to get exactly what you want (a certain type of unit with an elite status) and then to be able to capture it were really low (this may have changed too after I stopped playing the game). I remember there was an item that allowed to breeze through the level by auto-advancing and giving a huge boost to attack power. Even with that item
date: that allowed to clear a map in less than a minute
recommended: it took a lot of time to farm for certain types of units.\n\nAnyway the game was really good and enjoyable for a while
hoursPlayed: so I recommend trying it.\n\nForgot to mention: on Kongregate this game has 3.8/5 rating with almost 2m players (it's amount of players who tried the game
voteText: not the current amount of players I believe)."
